sub_title: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK
summary: Ambitious hydraulic & coastal graduate engineer who is passionate about fluid mechanics and dynamic interactions with sediment. Strives to learn from new challenges to understand and protect our coastal environments. A duty that you adopt as a civil engineer to serve society with basic needs and conveniences and to leave this earth, ultimately, even more, beautiful behind.

school.name: TU Delft | Civil Engineering and Geosciences

projects.title: Sand Engine Fieldwork | Applicability of LiDAR for wave measurements
projects.description:
A potential new and innovative way of obtaining measurements of wave hydrodynamics is by applying a laser scanner (LiDAR). The use of remote sensing techniques has become increasingly popular during the past three decades since these remote techniques are non-intrusive, easily, and safely deployed. 

During this research I successfully deployed a 3D laser scanning technique to acquire wave characteristics for studying the inner-surf and swash hydrodynamics. I was able to perform the measurements during a one-week fieldwork trip to the Sand Engine, together with nine other students. 

The developed software (in MATLAB), used to transform and analyze the data, can be found over here: https://github.com/CTaaban/Lagun-EX.git

contributors.headline: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK

projects.title: Coastline Modelling of Carrara Coast, Italy
projects.description: Collaborated with a team to investigate the best solution to mitigate beach erosion. The effects of local and foreshore nourishments on the coastline have been modelled using Delft3D and UNIBEST-CL+. Different alternatives have been modelled to optimize the coastline accretion by varying the shape and location of the nourishments. Finally, a sensitivity analysis has been performed to account for the variations of the wave conditions and sediment characteristics.

contributors.headline: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK

projects.title: Feasibility Application Bubble Screen in Rivers
projects.description:
Collaborated with a team to investigate the feasibility of applying an innovative bubble screen method in an open river end to prevent/minimize salt intrusion. A scaled-down lock exchange experiment has been performed which together with a numerical CFD model (SWASH) has been used to study the density-driven flows.

The experiment and developed SWASH model can be found over here: https://github.com/CTaaban/Bubble-Screen

contributors.headline: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK

projects.title: BSc Thesis | Wave Transmission over Submerged Dams
projects.description:
Under the supervision of the memorable Dr. ir. G. Ph. van Vledder I performed a research study to get more insight into the physics of wave transmission over submerged dams. A so-called ‘Grid-model’ in SWAN has been constructed which has been compared with an existing empirical relationship. The wave transmission in the empirical relationship is simplified since the dam is represented as an infinitely thin line (‘Line-model’), whereas the spatial characteristics of the dam are taken into account in the 1D Grid-model. 

During this study, I was able to implement my newly acquired software design knowledge. Software has been developed to automate the process of initiating the vast amount of simulation runs and to invoke and analyze the data. 

The SWAN model and developed software (Matlab) can be accessed over here: https://github.com/CTaaban/BEP.

contributors.headline: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK

projects.title: Minor Project | Building a Game from scratch
projects.description:
Together with five other students, we designed a game to conclude the Minor: Software Design & Application. All of us did not have any experience of creating a game beforehand, but during the minor we gathered the basic object-oriented programming skills (in java) to do so. However, it was the first time we got to code in C#. 

During this project, we made use of the SCRUM-method to manage the project planning and oversee the different tasks. Git was used for version control purposes. The most valuable experience about this project was the diversity of the team members, which led to a learning/feedback environment in which we all did benefit from each other. In this way, we were able to build an astonishing game. 

The developed game can be found over here: https://github.com/CTaaban/Game_BBBBBBBBBBBBB

contributors.headline: MSc. Graduate | Hydraulic Engineering | Environmental Fluid Mechanics & Coastal Engineering #OPENTONETWORK

projects.title: Artificial Intelligence Project | Robot does the groceries
projects.description: As a team of four students, we participated in a Grand Challenge of an Artificial Intelligence Course in which a simulated robot had to categorize products, profile its customer, determine a shopping list, learn to navigate, and figure out the fastest way through a virtual supermarket. In order to categorize the products, a two-layer neural network has been set up, trained, and validated. Based on the purchasing history, a Bayesian Network is able to back-propagate the customer profile and complete its shopping list. Finally, an Ant Colony Optimization (ACO) Path Finding and Genetic Algorithm determine the fastest way and order to the products, respectively.

profile_positions.title: Physics & Mathematics Teacher

profile_positions.description:
This graduation research study aims to provide a better understanding of the role of seagrass ecosystems in tropical, sheltered bays by assessing their impact on the morphodynamic behavior. Using a biogeomorphic model (Delft3D-FM), an interesting result has been found showing that seagrass meadows and coral reefs form a synergy, in which the stabilization of sediments provided by the individual ecosystems is facilitated, reinforced, and complemented by the proximate presence of the other ecosystem.

Performed an extensive sensitivity analyses to find bugs in proprietary software; detected and
resolved software technical errors in close collaboration with the Delft3D-FM development
team, results incorporated to improve the recent version of Delft3D-FM.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: I came up with the initiative to inspire the youth and joined the student association Ibn Firnas. During this year I did prepare and teach lessons on the transition between primary and secondary education and inspired 50 kids.
